availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: James H. G. Bush (Clark County, Kentucky, farmer, attorney, and politician)

body.p: Clark County, Kentucky, farmer, attorney, and politician. Kentucky native. Married to Julia W. Bush. Father of Richard H. C. Bush, Ellen "Lucy" K. Bush, Amanda E. Bush, John E. Bush, Laura B. Bush, Elizabeth Bush, and Malvina Bush. Farmer in Clark County, Kentucky, in 1850. Attorney in Clark County in 1860 and 1863. Owned fourteen enslaved persons in 1860. Member of the Senate of the Commonwealth of Kentucky from Clark County from 1861 to 1865.

ab.bibl: Seventh Manuscript Census of the United States (1850), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 1, p. 49; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Population Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 1, p. 40; Eighth Manuscript Census of the United States (1860), Slave Schedules, Kentucky, Clark County, District 1, p. 19-20; Ninth Manuscript Census of the United States (1870), Population Schedules, Kentucky, LaRue County, Magnolia Precinct, p. 2; Consolidated Lists of Civil War Draft Registrations, 1863-1865, AncestryKentucky, Seventh Congressional District, Clark County, Kentucky, 1863, p. 129; Lewis Collins and Richard H. Collins, History of Kentucky (Louisville, KY: Richard H. Collins, 1877), p. 130; Find A Grave, "James Harris Gentry Bush (1818-1866)," Memorial #50571025, http://www.findagrave.com/cgi-bin/fg.cgi?page=gr&GRid=50571025 (accessed August 16, 2017).
